title: Bachelor star Rachael Gouvignon bravely opens up about terrifying sexual assault
text:
Former Bachelor star Rachael Gouvignon has bravely revealed she was the victim of a sexual assault after she was raped at a house party aged 21.

The 34-year-old brunette said she was too afraid to go to the police after she was attacked in a dark alleyway.

Speaking about the harrowing ordeal on her podcast, Keep It Real with Rach and Tiff, Rachael said she kept the incident hidden from everyone - including her mum.

Scroll down for video

Brave: Bachelor star Rachael Gouvignon (pictured) has revealed she was the victim of a sexual assault aged 21

Talking to her podcasting co-host, Bachelor alumni Tiffany Scanlon, Rachael said she was at a house party with a group of girlfriends when the sexual assault took place.

'A few of my girlfriends were hooking up with boys,' she said.

'One of the boys I wasn't really interested in. He pulled me around the side of the party in a very dark alley and sexually abused me.'

Asked by co-host Tiffany to clarify what she meant, Rachael said: 'He raped me!'

Heartbreaking: Rachael said she was left on the grass 'crying her eyes out' as she tried to comprehend what had happened

She went on to say that after the party was shut down and her friends had dispersed, Rachael was left on the grass 'crying her eyes out' as she tried to comprehend what had happened.

But Rachael said she feared the police would not believe her account and decided not to report the attack.

On the podcast, the reality star said she didn't feel able to confide in her friends at the time, and instead kept the incident to herself.

'I've never been able to tell my Mum,' she admitted. 'One thing I hate is people worrying about me.'

Opening up: The reality star said she didn't feel able to confide in her friends at the time

Before Sunday's podcast, Rachael said she had only ever spoken about the ordeal to a psychologist.

Taking to her Instagram Story after the episode was released, Rachael explained why she kept the incident to herself for so long.

'So that's my story,' she said, as she hid her eyes behind dark sunglasses.

'I didn't think I would ever share this with anybody and I have opened it up to the whole world.

'Everybody deals with things in different ways. I like to keep things to myself.'

She said it had been a 'really confronting and weird afternoon' as she went public with her ordeal.

Rachael appeared on Richie Strahan's season of The Bachelor in 2016 and then returned on Bachelor In Paradise earlier this year.

For confidential support in Australia, call Lifeline on 13 11 14 or visit www.lifeline.org.au. Alternatively, call Kids Helpline on 1800 55 1800

If you or someone you know is affected by sexual assault or family violence, call 1800RESPECT or visit www.1800respect.org.au
description: Bachelor star Rachael Gouvignon (pictured) has bravely revealed she was the victim of a sexual assault when she was raped at a house party at age 21.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
